column4: so i have a wifi problem it says firmware missing can  anybody help?
i have and i dont know what im looking for
did you find a line for WLAN in the outpt of lspci -nn
no wlan in there at all
Did you already try System > Administration > Additional Drivers
yes it spits out downloading package indexes fail please check you network status most divers will no be availible
and then it says no proprietary drivers in use on this system
Hmm. but that computer is connected to the Internet, right?
no its not im on my ipod right now
Ok, you need to get connected so you can get the drivers (easiest way). Do you have an Ethernet cable to connect your laptop to your router?
i belive i do but i cant right now
si what do i do after i hook it up to the router?
Ok, you should do that when you get the chance. Just run "Additional Drivers"
It should detect your wireless card and install what you need.
and then everything will be nice and good in the world(i hope)?
hopefully. Wireless used to be a big hassle but Ubuntu did a great job of rounding up all the firmware
